name: mislocation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of wrongly saying or thinking that something is in a particular place or position: The book has not been well edited: examples of this include the mislocation of Aubeterre in the map on page 3, and the misidentification of a photograph on page 300. It is possible that later scribes recognized the apparent mislocation of the temporal marker and decided to restore it to its proper position. Related words
location (POSITION)
mislocate
a failure to find the exact position of someone or something: After a prisoner went missing inside the jail, there was said to be a failure to inform the controller about his "mislocation". Related word
location (FINDING) formal
